loans.name: Nhoem's Group

texts.en:
Nhoem is 52 years old, married and she has seven children, two daughters and five sons. She lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. Out of the seven children, she only has one child who is still in school. She earns a living through planting rice as her primary business. She has been in this business for almost thirty-three years now. As a rural farmer, she has challenged with the lack of working capital for her business. 

Nhoem's group consists of two members who are all female. She and her group member have been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles and they successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her make her living better. Currently, she can earn her daily income of up to 19,000 Cambodian Riel and manage to save around KHR9,000 per day. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a mother of two adult children.  She sells new clothes through door to door to her neighbors.  She has been in this business for the last six years and she dreams of opening a boutique in the future.  Zaituni has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She joined Yehu to access some loans, and she describes food to be her greatest monthly expense.

Seasonality is the major challenge facing her business.  Zaituni plans to use the loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
Xiomara tiene 36 años, es una mujer alegre y responsable que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo José, de 53 años, y sus tres hijos.

Se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, tiene una farmacia que llegó a implementar hace 8 años, donde le ha ido muy bien con el apoyo de su esposo. Ella aconseja a sus clientes sobre las mejores medicinas. La gente de su localidad siempre acude donde Xiomara, porque aparte de ser su consejera de malestares, es amiga y le tienen confianza.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y se siente contenta por contar con una financiera que apoye en sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia solidaria.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará variedad de medicamentos para implementar en su farmacia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 36 years old. She is a cheerful and responsible woman who lives in a rented house along with her 53-year-old husband, José, and her three children.

Xiomara sells medication; she has a pharmacy that she managed to open eight years ago, where things have gone very well for her with the support of her husband. She counsels her customers about the best medicines. The people in her area always turn to Xiomara, because apart from being their adviser about illnesses, she is their friend, and they trust her.

This is loan number nine with MFP and Xiomara feels happy to count on financing that supports her business plans. In her communal bank, she is a supportive member.

With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN) that she is now requesting, Xiomara will purchase a variety of medications to offer in her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase additional medications for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon, age 31, is a resident from Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She is married with three school-age kids. She owns a small piece of land, on which she cultivates rice crops. Nevertheless, the output from the land not provides enough sustenance for her family within the year. This has the effect of making them meet difficulties and spends much on her daily food. To cover the expenses, Chhon has dedicated herself to the business of make bamboo baskets for extra income, earing approximately USD 2.50 per day while her husband works as a civil servant to distribute his income to better the living.

With the loan amounts of USD 900, Chhon would like to purchase stock of rice to meet the needs of her living. Also, with the remainders, she will purchase electric supplies and electric wire to make connection electricity to use in her family. She hopes that, through using the loan, she will be able to develop her living status. She is very grateful to our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice to meet the needs of her living.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children aged three and ten. He is an honest and diligent businessman. He operates a retail business, where he has been selling milk for four years. His business is located near residential areas, and his primary customers are local residents.  Not only does Jackson sell milk, but he is also employed in order to increase his income. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of milk. He will use the loan of 5,800 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a solar lantern to do away with the cost of buying kerosene and candles for lightning his home and to also use it for charging the family's mobile phones.  This is the third loan that he is requesting from SMEP DTM.  The other loan he had taken, he managed to pay the entire amount. His business plan and goal is to improve his business. He hopes that in the future he will improve the standard of living of his family by the profits that will be generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en: Lamula  is married with children and two children go to school. She takes of additional family members. She sells charcoal and bananas at the market. She sells her products on retail basis. She works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of shs 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a whole sale business and educate her children up to university, she would also like to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new collection of summer clothes for sale

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. For the last five years, she has operated a food stall from her home. In addition, she sells new clothes.  She says that the high cost of commodities is her major challenge and that she spends a large amount on food and school fees every month. 

Tabitha joined Kiva partner Yehu to access funds to help boost her business.  With the loan of 15,000 KES, she intends to purchase bundles of new clothes for sale.  Tabitha dreams of opening a cereal business in future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá Group

texts.es:
Elvira es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Jehová Proveerá, un grupo con mucha trayectoria de la comunidad indígena de Shiroles en Talamanca. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, de 36 años y madre de 5 hijos, todos menores de edad, y únicamente 2 estudian, ya que no cuentan con los ingresos necesarios para que todos asistan a la escuela ó el colegio. Está familia de muy escasos recursos trabajan en la agricultura, es una pequeña finca de su propiedad siembran plátano, y los principales obstáculos que deben enfrentar es el bajo precio que se ven obligados a vender sus cultivos a los intermediarios,  ya que no tiene la posibilidad de trasladar sus productos a otras zonas para venderlos a precios justos. 
Está solicitante ya ha recibido 4 préstamos,  y todos lo ha invertido en la producción de plátano dándole la oportunidad de comprar insumos para el cuido del cultivo, y así seguir produciendo. Toda la familia trabaja en la finca ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para ellos. 
Junto a Doña Elvira hay 6 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Jehová Proveerá Women’s Bank, a group Shiroles indigenous community of Talamanca. She is a hard-working, 36-year-old mother of 5 dependent children. Of the children, only 2 go to school, as the family doesn’t have enough money for all of them to attend school. This family of very modest means, works in agriculture. They have a small farm where they grow plantain; the challenges they face include having to sell their product to middlemen at a lower price, because they themselves don’t have the possibility to transport their product to other areas where they could sell for a fair price. She has received 4 loans and each was invested in the production of plantain, allowing her to buy supplies for the caretaking of the crop, and that way, continue production. The whole family works on the farm as it’s their only source of income.
Together with Elvira, there are 6 more members who will be investing in agricultural or commercial activities.

loans.use: buy the supplies needed to grow plantain.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina is from Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Felina is married and has four children. To make a living, Felina manages a transport service-based business. Felina has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Felina joined GDMPC. Felina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of four children, all of whom are adults. She has operated a poultry business for the past ten years. In addition, she sells coconuts and operates a tailoring business. She runs all the three businesses from her home. Jane lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Chicken diseases are her major challenge.  Jane spends most of her income on food during the month. 

Jane joined Kiva partner Yehu mainly due to her need for a loan.  With the 20,000 KES loan, she plans to purchase coconuts for sale and clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale and clothing materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth is 51 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children in a rural area of the Thmor Koul District. She cares for her three sons and works in the family's business. House building is her family’s main source of income and they have been in this business for five years.  The main challenge for the family business is the lack of working capital to run the business well. 

Reth's group consists of two female members. She has been with Kiva partner VisionFund Cambodia (VFC) for three loan cycles while the other group member has been with VFC for one cycle. Reth successfully paid back the previous loans, which helped her family run their business well. Reth, who is the leader of the group, will use her portion of this new loan to buy construction materials for the family house building business. She hopes to increase the business activity and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for the family house building business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is married with two children. Jeanne is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jeanne is providing transportation services to the local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for six years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2008, Jeanne joined GDMPC. In the future, Jeanne hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 39 years old, married and blessed with four children who are going to school.

He has been selling animal feeds for the last six years and gets an income of KES 50,000 per month.

He is applying for his second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy animal feed to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to have a chain of animal feed wholesale outlets.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.to sell

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar is 27 years old and a married woman. She has been operating a rice farming business to generate her income while her husband works in the construction field. She has been in her business for over 10 years. She earns an income that barely seems to cover her daily costs. She usually uses her income for food and allowances for her only child.

Due to the need for capital to support her husband’s business, Sar decided to ask for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to purchase construction supplies, which will enable her husband to provide his construction services efficiently. She hopes to send her child to a good university in the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Sonia Aurelia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 55 años pero es tiene la alegría y el entusiasmo de una joven de 20 años, es madre de un hijo, es quien la acompaña siempre y es su mano derecha en todo ya que hace algunos años se separo del padre de su hijo y desde entonces lo saco adelante sola, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, la ciudad de Chincha se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, así como también es muy conocida ya que es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y también sus pobladores tienen una riquísima sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de la zona. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta ver televisión pero lo que más le gusta es comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pato”. 

Día a día Sonia trabaja en su negocio de lavandería y venta de productos naturales, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque da un buen servicio y sobre todo es cumplida con los clientes y siempre les ofrece facilidad para el pago.

Sonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar muebles para su vivienda ya que actualmente solo tiene unos banquitos, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para u familia y seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Sonia is 55 years old, but she has the cheerfulness and enthusiasm of a 20-year-old. She has one son, who is always with her and helps her with everything, since a few years ago she separated from his father and raised him on her own from that point forward. Her home is located in the city of Chincha. 

The city of Chincha is known for its lovely beaches, and is also greatly renowned for being home to one of the great glories in peruvian sports. Its residents are also exceptionally good at preparing the typical dishes from the region. When she has a little free time she enjoys watching television, but what she enjoys the most is eating one of her favorite dishes, which is the delicious rice with duck.

Day by day, Sonia works in her laundry business and selling natural products. She dedicates around 8 hours a day to her business and may serve up to 10 customers during the day. She believes her business is going well because she offers good service and, most of all, she is reliable and always offers her customers easy payment options.

Sonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered her she will be able to purchase furniture for her home, since she currently has only a few small benches. This will allow her to have a better quality of life for her family and to keep fighting every day for her greatest dream to come true: to become a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Zaveria

texts.en:
Zaveria is a married woman with 4 children who are between the ages of 11 and 23 years old. She describes herself as a caring, loving parent. Zaveria operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located near a town and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the outbreak of diseases. 

Zaveria will use the 40,000 KES loan to purchase animal feed at a cost of 20,000 KES and farm inputs, such as fertilizer, at a cost of 20,000 KES.  Earlier, she requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM) and successfully repaid the entire amount.  Zaveria’s business goal is to build a good cattle shelter within 5 years. She hopes that she will be able to buy a farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and farming inputs for her dairy business.

loans.name: Jilber Emilio

texts.es:
El joven Jilber Emilio es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se gana la vida laborando como operador donde tiene gran experiencia, actividad que le ha permitido llevar por muchos años el sustento a su hogar e ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos unos para mejorar su casita y otros para asuntos personales los cuales gracias a estos ha mejorado su calidad de vida.
En estos momentos necesita un crédito para adquirir una motocicleta para trasladarse a su centro de labores el cual queda alejado de la ciudad y en la actualidad se le  hace difícil donde tiene que madrugar para estar a la hora exacta de entrada y ser responsable.
Espera que Ceprodel le apoye con su solicitud y confía en Dios que su sueño se hará realidad de poder adquirir este vehículo para ahorrar tiempo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Young Jilber Emilio is from the town of El Sauce.  He earns a living working as an employee where he has much experience.  It’s an activity that has allowed him to support his home for many years gradually making improvements to his house.

He’s worked with Ceprodel for several years; he’s had four home improvement loans and others for personal use thanks to which he’s improved his quality of life.

At present, he needs a loan to buy a motorcycle to use to get to work because his workplace is far from the city and it’s difficult for him now because he needs to get up at dawn in order to be responsible and get to work at the exact starting time.

He hopes that Ceprodel will support him with his request and he trusts in God that his dream will become a reality and he will be able to acquire this vehicle to save time at work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and she has two children who both attend school.  She also takes care of two additional family members (mother and father).  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying rent, school fees and electricity bills.

She sells charcoal from her home on a retail basis seven days a week.  She has been in this business for five years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO in order to buy bags of charcoal.  In addition to her charcoal business, she sells piped water.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to build a commercial house and to educate her two children through university.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Deborah operates a green grocery where she sells her goods at the market.  She aspires to open a shop in the future.  She has been in business for the past five years, selling to her neighbors.  Seasonality is the major challenge she faces.

She joined Yehu to gain access to credit to boost her business.  Deborah plans to purchase fruits and vegetables using the loan of 50,000 KES.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rene Mauricio

texts.es: René Mauricio García Flores, cuenta con treinta y cuatro años de edad, es comerciante en pequeño, vive en casa propia y junto a él su hijo de 6 años de edad y esposa quien además de atender junto a su esposo el negocio se dedica a cuidar al hijo en casa y las labores domésticas. René posee una tienda donde provee artículos de primera necesidad como azúcar, sal, maíz, leche, pan dulce, golosinas entre otras muchas. También posee una venta los fines de semana de tortas, hamburguesas y tacos en variedad de carne de cerdo, pollo o mixtos que son deliciosamente preparadas por su esposa. La pareja participa en ambos negocios ubicados en su misma casa de residencia, y ambos tienen un anhelo en común: ofrecer un mejor futuro a su hijo  que pronto iniciará sus primeros pasos escolares. Como en los últimos días han invertido para instalar el negocio de las tortas, han tenido que dejar de surtir la tienda con productos que a diario demandan sus clientes y es así como René como un buen administrador ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito con el cual pueda comprar lácteos, carnes, embutidos, sodas, huevos, medicinas, pampers y otros artículos desechables que le piden. Espera poder contar con éste financiamiento y así no perder su clientela que tantos años le ha costado consolidar de no contar con la variedad de productos que le caracterizan; es así como René éste responsable padre de familia espera seguir llevando el sustento diario a su familia
texts.en:
René Mauricio García Flores, 34, is a small trader who lives in his own home with his 6-year-old son and wife. His wife, aside from running the business with her husband, also cares for their son and tends to the house. 

René has a store where he sells basic supplies such as sugar, salt, corn, milk, pastries, and candy, among many other items. He also has a business selling pies, hamburgers and tacos made of pork, chicken or a variety of fillings, which are deliciously prepared by his wife. The couple runs both businesses from their home and shares a common desire: to provide a better future for their son, who will soon be taking his first steps as a student.

As they have invested in setting up their meat pie selling business in recent days, they have had to stop stocking their general store with products their customers request every day. Consequently René, like a good administrator, has decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan so that he can buy dairy goods, meat, sausages, sodas, eggs, medicine, Pampers and other perishables their customers request. He hopes he can rely on this funding and thus not lose his customers, which have taken so many years to attract, because they cannot find the variety of products they need. In this way, René hopes to continue providing his family with their daily bread and carrying out his duties as a responsible father.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, meat, sausages, sodas, eggs, medicine, Pampers and other perishable articles.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a single mother of seven children, five of whom are in school.  She lives in a rented house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mwanasiti has been selling clothes for the past seven years and she dreams of opening a boutique in the future.  She sells her clothes door-to-door, mostly to people in the neighborhood.  Seasonality is her major challenge.  Mwanasiti intends to use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 20 años, vive al lado de su esposa, juntos tienen un pequeño al cual quieren muchísimo y es la razón por la cual Luis trabaja de sol a sol para darle una vida de calidad y sobre todo con amor. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, la ciudad de Chincha se caracteriza por sus playas hermosas, así como también es muy conocida ya que es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y también sus pobladores tienen una riquísima sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de la zona. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta pasarlo con su familia y también aprovecha de vez en cuando para comer su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Luis trabaja brindando su servicio de vigilancia en la municipalidad de su distrito, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo muy cuidadoso.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mejoramiento en su vivienda, sobre todo poner pisos, refaccionar las paredes, de esta manera podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y seguirá luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20-year-old young man. He lives with his wife, and they have a small son whom they love very much. This is the reason why Luis works from sunrise to sunset to give him a good quality of life, with much love. 

His house is located in the city of Chincha, which is noted for its beautiful beaches. It is also well known as the birthplace of great Peruvian sport heroes. Also, its inhabitants have a most delicious way of seasoning the traditional dishes of the area. 

When he has free time, he likes to spend it with his family, and also once in a while enjoys eating his favorite dish, the very delicious "arroz chaufa" (Peruvian-style Chinese fried rice). 

With much enthusiasm, Luis provides security services for his local municipality. He works around nine hours a day. He believes that his work is going well because he is very responsible and above all, very careful.

Luis is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him,he will be able to undertake improvements to his home, particularly the installation of floors and repairing of walls. In this way, he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family, and will continue striving day by day to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have my own house, and give my son a good education."

loans.use: To make improvements to his house, such as installing floors and repairing walls.

loans.name: Futuro Para Un Bienestar  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar está formado por 13 socias y 1 socio que viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, por la naturaleza que la rodea y por su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente es amable gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias tienen una gran fortaleza y ganas de salir adelante con su trabajo arduo que lo realizan día a día.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos, dos de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y ayuda economícamente. Su esposo es de profesión chofer por lo que trabaja dando clases de conducción, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.

La Señora. Gladys se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y es comerciante hace 3 años, vende ropa y cosméticos de varias marcas, su mercadería la vende recorriendo por las casas de sus amigas y conocidas de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. 

Su meta es crecer en su negocio hasta llegar a tener una boutique.

En la foto se encuentra una señora con blusa roja y compa gris a cuadros que es pariente de una de las socias pero no pertenece al grupo.
texts.en:
The "Futuro Para Un Bienestar" communal bank is made up of 13 members (12 women and one man), who live in various places in the city of Cuenca. This city is much visited because of the beauty of its historic center, the nature that surrounds it, and its varied cuisine that captivates the palate of those who visit. Its people are kind and friendly, and still maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples. The members have great fortitude, and a desire to succeed with the hard work they do day by day.

One of the members of this group is Gladys. She is 54, married, and has three children. Two of her children are married and live independently. Her unmarried daughter works and helps her financially. Her husband is a driver by trade, and works giving driving lessons. She doesn't have her own house, so she rents.

Gladys does her household chores and has been a merchant for three years. She sells clothing and several brands of cosmetics. She sells her merchandise door-to-door, visiting the homes of her friends and acquaintances from Monday to Friday, with no fixed hours.

This is the first loan she is undertaking in the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy clothing for re-stocking her merchandise. 

Her goal is to see her business grow until she manages to have a boutique.

A woman with a red blouse and grey checked sweater is seen in the photo, who is a relative of one of the members, but does not belong to the group.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, eggs, bread, cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Odila

texts.es: Odilia de 51 años de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil; sus principales productos son blusas, pantalones, y vestidos. Esta actividad la inició desde sus 18 años, cuando aprendió por tradición, pues su madre también se dedicó a ella y Odilia creció ayudándola. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a estudiar en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA” y terminar la carrera de Dirección Comercial; para poner en práctica lo aprendido  con su prima dio apertura un taller de confecciones  en casa de su tía, con ello afianzó sus conocimientos y adquirió mucha mas experiencia y una gran clientela,  hasta el punto que debió mudarse para ubicarse mas cómoda y estratégicamente.   Durante dos años trabajó con su prima en este taller, pero finalmente ella emprendió su viaje a otra ciudad y Odilia debió nuevamente re direccionar su propuesta sola,  como lo hizo durante 5 años en los que su microempresa creció, se tecnificó y se perfeccionó. Al organizar su familia y con el nacimiento de su hija, se concentró en ella durante 5 años y cuando estuvo todo listo para trabajar nuevamente, retomó su arte, trabajando en diversos talleres como empleada, allí aprendió la confección de ropa de fiestas, vestidos de bodas y en general de alta costura. Así fue como al estar  preparada para emprender su propia aventura de negocios, su cuñada fue quien la ayudó, pues a su nombre obtuvo el crédito de las primeras maquinarias y con ello el ejercicio de lograr clientes sostenibles, para poder pagar esta adquisición, con sus utilidades como efectivamente lo hizo. En la actualidad su estructura está conformada por 2 máquinas planas, 1 fileteadora 1 maquina familiar, tiene aproximadamente 150 clientes y vende a crédito y de contado; ella para realizar la transacción pide un anticipo del 50% y el saldo, una vez entrega la prenda. Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes cercanos. Así mismo como vive con su hija de 15 años, esta la ayuda mucho en el negocio, porque tiene una fuente de creatividad inagotable,  que Odilia aprovecha,  pues es genial en el diseño de las prendas, oficio que le apasiona. De su hija Odilia se siente muy orgullosa y todos los días trabaja, para ofrecerle muchas oportunidades de que sea exitosa, en lo que a ella le guste, que es precisamente  la línea de diseños. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante l cual comprará una máquina industrial recubridora, para dar un mejor acabado a la prenda, una plancha a vapor y rollos de telas para elaborar vestidos femeninos y tener un stock que mostrar para el día de las madres, una de las temporadas de mas movimiento comercial, en la que usualmente se incrementan las utilidades de Odilia, que la ayudan al cumplimento de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Odilia, 51, makes clothes for women, men and children.  Her main products are blouses, pants and dresses.  She started this work at the age of 18 when she learned it by tradition because her mother was also in this occupation and Odilia grew up helping her.  Her desire for self-improvement led her to study at SENA, the National Learning Service and to complete a course in Commercial Direction.  To put everything she’d learned into practice, she opened her first sewing shop with her cousin at her aunt’s house and strengthened her skills there and gained much experience and a good clientele to such an extent that she was able to relocate to a more comfortable, strategic place.  

She worked in this shop with her cousin for two years but eventually moved to a different city and Odilia started anew to run her business by herself.  She did this for five years and her micro business grew, she became more technologically adept and she perfected her skills.

When she formed her own family and had her daughter, she concentrated on her for the next five years and when she was ready to return to work again she retook her art working in various workshops as an employee.  There she learned how to make party dresses, wedding gowns and haute couture in general. This was how when she was ready again to start a business of her own, her sister-in-law helped her because she took out a loan in her name to buy her first machines and with that she was able to acquire regular customers to be able to pay for this purchase and with profits is exactly what she did.

Her shop currently has two plain machines, one overlock machine and one family machine.  She has approximately 150 customers and she sells on credit and for cash.  To accept a contract she asks for a 50% down payment and the remainder is paid upon delivery.  She pays cash for her supplies in nearby stores.

She lives with her 15 year old daughter who helps her very much in the business because her creativity is bottomless and Odilia takes advantage of it because she is genius when it comes to clothing design, something that she’s passionate about.  Odilia is very proud of her daughter and she works every day to provide her with more opportunities to be successful at whatever she likes which is precisely designing the clothing line.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy an industrial blind stitch machine to better finish the articles of clothing, a steam iron and bolts of fabric to make women’s dresses and have stock available to display for Mother’s Day, one of the seasons of highest commercial movement when Odilia’s profits usually increase helping her to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, a steam iron and bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator for water pumping.

loans.name: Esier

texts.en: Esier lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He he has been earning a living through providing transportation services for 3 years to support the needs of his child. He earns an income of PHP 10,000 per month for this business. As a 24-year old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than seeing his child successful. Without hesitation, Esier would like to borrow PHP 35,000 from GDMPC Microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. In 2011, he joined GDMPC. His plan for the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a 51-year-old resident of Jimenez, Misamis, Occdental. She provides for her 9 children's needs from the small amount (PHP 3,000) she earns from her garden business. She has gardened for 2 years to supplement the income from her husband, who is a farmer. 
However, Demetria joined GDMPC this year and has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Bopha is 23 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is involved in breeding pigs and distilling alcohol. He earns approximately $5 per day. In order to provide enough food for the pigs, Bopha is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase fodder for breeding pigs. This money will help her pigs grow faster. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a resident of Murang’a and has been active in farming for ten years. He lives with his family of three children in their rural home in Murang'a where he carries out farming and sells his produce of milk, tomatoes, and butternuts to the local markets.

Benson has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and  fertilizer at 10,000 KES, irrigation pipes at 5,000 KES and pay for seeds and farmhand labor at 20,000 KES. He says he hopes to improve the living standards of his family and educate his children with the farming income.

He says the major challenge is dry spells and poor markets with low price offers for farm produce. He plans to make proper use of Juhudi Kilimo loans.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes, seeds, and to pay farmhands

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven de 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como técnico electricista y al lado de sus 3 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 1,9 y 10 años , por quienes da la vida y todo el esfuerzo y el sacrificio que realizan es por ellos para darles una vida con calidad y con mucho amor de familia. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del años, por ello se le conoce como la tierra del sol eterno, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Maribel le gusta leer, también en ocasiones le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”; ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Idiomas.

Con mucho entusiasmo y sobre todo esfuerzo Maribel trabaja diariamente en su negocio de venta de hamburguesas, salchipollos, salchipapas, pollo broster, entre otros, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha fe y sobre todo porque atiende de manera amable a sus clientes.

Maribel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su negocio, de esta manera conservar de manera apropiada los alimentos que utiliza para la preparación de sus platillos y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, así ella seguirá trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young woman of 28. She lives with her husband who works as an electrician, and with her three children, ages 1,9 and 10. For them she gives her life and all her effort. The sacrifices they make are for them: to give them a good quality of life in a loving family.

Her house is located in the city of Ica, which is known for having a warm climate at any time of the year. For this it is known as the "Land of Eternal Sun."

As well, agriculture is developing, especially the cultivation of cotton, paprika, grapes, asparagus and other crops. When she has free time available, Maribel likes to read. As well, sometimes she likes to prepare her favorite dish, the very tasty "arroz con pollo.” (rice with chicken). She only went as far as high school, but would like to have studied languages.

With a great deal of enthusiasm and especially effort, Maribel works daily in her business selling hamburgers, salchipollos (fried potatoes with shredded chicken and hot dogs), salchipapas (fried potatoes and hot dogs), fried chicken, and other foods. 

She works at her business for around seven hours a day, and can serve up to 20 customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she has a strong faith, and above all because she serves her customers in a friendly way.

Maribel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy a refrigerator for her business, so that she can properly store the food she uses to prepare her dishes. This way she will be able to improve her income and her quality of life, and continue working to make her greatest dream a reality: ”To have my own house."

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Fidel is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Fidel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. Fidel has been in business for 5 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities. In 2008, Fidel joined GDMPC. Fidel is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como obrero desde hace muchos años actividad que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, resolver problemas personales e ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
cabe señalar que tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado 11 créditos para gastos personales y para mejorar su vivienda donde le agradece a esta Institución el apoyo incondicional en momentos difíciles que no se pueden resolver con el pequeño salario que gana.
En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de medicamentos y pago de consultas médicas, esperando y confiando en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada.
texts.en:
Alcides is originally from the town of El Sauce. He has worked as a construction worker for many years, and this activity has allowed him to earn his daily living, solve personal problems, and improve his home little by little.
It should be noted that he has been working with Ceprodel for many years, and has received 11 loans for personal expenses and home improvement. He is grateful for the institution's unconditional support during hard times which could not be overcome with the modest salary he earns. 
Right now he is in need of a loan to purchase medicine and pay for medical visits. He is hoping and trusting God that his request will be approved.

loans.use: with medicine and medical visit expenses.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivian is from Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children. To make a living, Vivian has been operating a transport service for 5 years and earning PHP 5,000 a month.
In 2008, Vivian joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is 32 years old. He is married with two children who are both in school. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a staff member. He paid his previous loans on time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay laborers.

He hopes to purchase more farming land.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay laborers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una persona muy visionaria y con ganas de salir adelante y ser una buena microempresaria.
Nos cuenta que se dedica al comercio ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a sus vecinos de la zona. Hace 4 años que se dedica a esto, y comenta que empezó con un una pequeña tienda, pero gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido levantar su negocio e ir creciendo. Su sueño es poder tener una familia, ya que ella es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Julia quiere poder seguir creciendo en los negocios y es por eso que solicita una pequeña ayuda, ya que quiere abastecer su negocio con lácteos y bebidas, ya que estos productos siempre tienen muy buena salida. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Julia is from the city of Encarnación.  She’s a very visionary person who very much wants to get ahead and be a good micro businesswoman.

She tells us that she works in commerce; she has a well-stocked store that she supplies her neighbors with.  She’s been in this for four years and comments that she started out with a small store but thanks to her effort, work and sacrifice she’s been able to lift her business up and to grow.  Her dream is to have a family since she’s single and has no children.

Julia wants to be able to continue growing in business and this is why she’s asking for a little help because she wants to stock her store with dairy products and beverages since these products always sell well.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting because it will be very useful for her.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and dairy products.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nuevo Amanecer gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio se encuentra en el 12º ciclo, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y emprendedoras todas se dedican a variadas actividades con la que ayudan a sus familias.
 La Sra Maria Isabel es una de las miembros, y es también la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y cuenta que tiene muchos clientes ya que sus comidas son muy ricas, su meta es poder seguir creciendo y algún día poder tener un gran negocio de comidas y de esa forma tener mayores ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella desea invertir más en su negocio, por lo que pide la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya, ya que desea comprar carnes, condimentos, harina, y otros, ya que los utiliza mucho en sus comidas.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) committee thanks to its work and sacrifice is now in its 12th cycle; they are very self-sacrificing, enterprising women in a variety of occupations to help their families.

María Isabel is one of the members and also the group president. She’s a person who always strives to the maximum degree to get ahead and help her family.  María works selling all types of food and she relates that she has many customers because her dishes are very delicious.  Her goal is to continue growing and one day have a food business to earn higher income and continue helping her family.

She wants to invest more in her business which is why she’s asking for help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya because she wants to buy meat, condiments, flour and others that she uses very much in her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, flour and others.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, pues manifiesta que necesita arrendar el terreno donde realizara el cultivo de maíz y frijol, estos prestamos han ayudado a Miguel en su trabajo agrícola, proporcionándole los recursos económicos para poder comprarse lo necesario y arrendar el terreno.
Su efecto con esto ha sido positivo, pues ha logrado tener un buen trabajo y sus cultivos han sido abundantes, le ha ayudado también en la alimentación para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel decided to request a new loan because he says that he needs to rent the land where he will grow corn and beans. These loans have helped Miguel with his farm work by providing him with the financial resources to be able to purchase what he needs and rent the land.
He has had positive results, because he has managed to have good work and his crops have been plentiful. This has also helped feed his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and rent land for farming.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
A widow in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Sang is 47 years old and has two children who are still in school.  She earns a living by selling grocery items in front of her house and she has been in this business for five years.  With her current business, she has managed to earn a daily income of 8,500 KHR but can only save around 1,500 KHR each day.  The main challenge she faces in her business is the lack of sufficient working capital.

This is Sang’s first loan with VisionFund and her group member has been with VisionFund for four cycles.  Sang is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund and wants to use her portion to buy more grocery items such as seasoning, soap, detergent, eggs, etc. for her business.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is widowed with four children and only two of her four children go to school. She doesn’t take care additional family members. She sells bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business. She would also like to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yoliza

texts.es:
Yoliza es una joven madre de 24 años. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar su casa propia donde vive junto a su hijo Francesco de 3 años; quien es el motivo de todo el esfuerzo que realiza.

Ella se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, labor que lleva realizando hace cuatro años y asegura que le va muy bien. Para mantener sus terrenos y durante la cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes conocen sus terrenos. Las cosechas que realiza Yoliza las lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilo. Su prioridad es poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas para que siempre den buena producción.
Desde que se enteró de los préstamos que brinda MFP no dudó en solicitar en informarse para seguir desarrollando sus planes.

Este es su primer crédito y se siente agradecida la oportunidad que le brindan. Por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yoliza is a 24-year-old young mother.  Thanks to her effort she managed to buy her own house, where she lives with her three-year-old son Francesco, who is the motivation for all her effort.

She works the land to grow cacao plants.  She has done this work for four years and she guarantees that it is going very well for her.  To maintain her plots of land and during the harvest she has the help of day laborers who are familiar with her land.  Yoliza takes her harvests to sell at the distribution centers of her town, where they give her good profits per kilo.  Her priority is to be able to maintain all her plants so they always produce well.

Since she found out about the loans that MFP gives, she did not hesitate to inform herself about continuing to develop her plans.  This is her first loan and she is grateful for the opportunity it gives her.  For her part, she promises to be punctual in making her payments.  Also, she is grateful to her communal bank for working with responsible people.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) that she is requesting she will buy bags of fertilizer to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plants and fertilizer, as well as to clean his plots of land.

loans.name: Gloria Marisol

texts.es:
Gloria, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprándose un surtido de ropa nueva blusas, faldas, short, camisetas, con lo que espera tener una acepacion de los clientes y poder ofrecerles la variedad de estilos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le permitio crecer y tener mercadería necesaria para atender de la mejor manera a  los clientes, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado su familia se encuentra mejor.
texts.en: Gloria is applying for a new loan in order to continue investing in her business, buying a new inventory of new clothing such as blouses, skirts, shorts and t-shirts, with which she hopes to attract more clients and be able to offer them a variety of styles. She thinks that the previous loan helped her to grow the business and to have the necessary merchandise to better attend to her clients and that her economic conditions have improved and her family finds itself in a better position.

loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shorts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la inversión en el negocio, comprara sodas, refrescos, quesillo, repollo, aceite, con estos productos espera continuar trabajando para su familia, que le generen mejores ingresos.
Ella considera que  el préstamo anterior fue una gran ayuda para ella y su familia crecio en el negocio, mejorando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to invest in her business by purchasing sodas, beverages, soft cheese, cabbage, and cooking oil.  With these products she hopes to continue working for her family, and she hopes they generate better income.

She feels that the previous loan was a big help to her and to her family.  Her business grew, which improved her income.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beverages, soft cheese, cabbage, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ulchaboi

texts.ru: Улчабой женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 8 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Отходы от выращивания идут на корм скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемую прибыль. Он намерен использовать свою прибыль для ремонта своего дома. Улчабой хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ulchaboi is married and has two children. For over eight years he's made a living by growing crops and buying and selling cattle. The leftovers from the crops go towards feeding the cattle. Ulchaboi wants to expand his business and obtain higher profits. With those profits, he'll be able to repair his house. 
Ulchaboi is asking for a loan in order to purchase some livestock and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy sweet and Irish potatoes, rice, flour, bananas and serving plates. Her major business challenges include seasonality and increasing rental fees. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, serving plates, sweet potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
Claudia, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para crecer con su negocio, comprando productos no perecederos para el negocio como granos básicos, aceite, condimentos, pastas, con esto espera tener un aumento en sus ventas.
El efecto con el préstamo anterior fue muy bueno, mejoro la variedad en el negocio, ha tenido mejores ventas y mas trabajo para obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia is requesting a new loan in order to purchase merchandise to grow her business. She plans to purchase nonperishable products, such as staple grains, oil, condiments, pasta, etc, and she hopes this will lead to an increase in sales.

Her previous loan was extremely helpful, and allowed her to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, as well as increase her sales and overall income.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, oil, condiments, pasta.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Odbayar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his children are school and kindergarten students. He started his grocery shop business in 1996. His shop location is good, and his shop is well-known around the neighborhood for his nice service and quality products. Ever since he opened his shop, his business has been expanding steadily. Many buildings have been built around the neighborhood; therefore, his market demand is increasing. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more grocery supplies at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery supplies at wholesale prices

loans.name: Enhbolor

texts.en:
Enhbolor is 43 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband quit his work due to a health condition and her daughter is a school student. 

Enhbolor started her garment retailing business in 1998 by renting a counter in the market. Her garments are very high fashion and reasonably priced. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 

She's requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase summer garments. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my daughter is growing up, she needs my support more than ever."

loans.use: To purchase summer garments.

loans.name: Oeng's Group

texts.en:
Oeng is a 50-year-old mother of four children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Two of her four children work at the family's business as farmers. To make a living, Oeng has been farming rice on her 2.5 hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for 33 years. With her current business, she can earn up to KHR 13,800 each day to support her family. She has faced a challenge with the lack of working capital for her business. 

This is the first loan for Oeng's group with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice to sell for a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan is 52 years old and lives with her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder child helps with her business and her younger sons are college students. 

She started her construction material retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She started off by selling only door locks. Now she sells various kinds of materials. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my business is picking up, I am finally able to help with my son's college tuition." 

She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members: her brother and his son. She sells secondhand clothes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in business for 5 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water.

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and building rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Yuldoshboi

texts.ru: Юлдошбой уже более 20 лет занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он покупает скот на местном базаре и выращивает их в течении 6 месяцев, а затем продает за выгодную цену. В бизнесе помогает супруга. На полученный доход от бизнеса хочет купить мебель для своего дома. Юлдошбой запрашивает займ для покупки 6 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
For over twenty years, Yuldoshboi has made a living by buying and selling cattle, as well as raising crops. He purchases cattle at the local market, fattens them for a period of six months and then sells them for a profit. His wife helps him run the business. 

Yuldoshboi would like to obtain some furniture for his house using proceeds from his business. He's asking for a loan in order to buy six heads of short-horned cattle. He's hoping for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Susana  tiene 40 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 17 y 23 años, la Sra. Susana se dedica a la  venta de comida, ella vende pollo al espiedo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Susana utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de asador para pollo al espiedo por su negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero, para la compra de un asador que mucha falta le hace e n su negocio, la Sra. Susana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela para así generar mayores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su hogar y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Susana is 40 years old and has three children that are 17 and 23 years old.  She works in food sales and sells rotisserie chicken.  This is her first loan cycle with the bank.   Susana will use the loan to buy a chicken grill for her business.  

Susana needs the loan because she lacks the money to buy a grill herself, and it's important that she buys one for her business.  Susana is facing some challenges in her business, as it is difficult to increase her clientele and thus increase her income.  She will use the earnings from her business to buy household items and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie chicken grill

loans.name: Felictus

texts.en: Felictus is single with four children, and two of them are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. She also gets additional income from selling charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but they have no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Myanganzul

texts.en: Myanganzul is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service by his motorcycle. Her children are school students. She started her garment business in 2002 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Her products are highly fashionable and reasonably cheap. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says,"It was hard to expand my business when my children were young. Now that they are old enough, I finally have an opportunity to expand my business." She is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to expand her range of products.

loans.use: To expand her range of products

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be social, honest and committed. She operates a beauty salon and has a retail store where she sells gas cylinders and provides hair services such as plaiting, blow drying, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays in the refilling of gases into the cylinders. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to purchase more gas cylinders. Earlier on, Ann had requested a loan of Kes 50,000 which she managed to pay off well.  

Her business goal is to run another gas selling retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses and educate her children.

loans.use: to add to her stock of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Gladis Aidee

texts.es:
Gladis, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en el negocio, comprara leche para elaborar queso y cuajada, con esto espera tener mejores ingresos en sus ventas y poder tener trabajo para seguir mejorando con su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, teniendo la mercadería necesario para vender, sus condiciones han cambiado, teniendo mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is seeking a new loan to invest in her business.  She will buy milk so that she can process cheese and curd.  With this she hopes to increase her sales and she will be able to continue working in order to continue improving her family's situation.

With her previous loan she had a positive outcome.  She had all the necessary merchandise to sell, her conditions had changed, and she made a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk in order to continue processing dairy products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (Mother and Father). She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of second-hand clothes. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent, and transportation.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children and three of her children go to school. She takes care of her mother. She sells secondhand clothes door to door on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water to her neighbors. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the ever-increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and also to start importing used clothes. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and for food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 21 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades e 1 y 4 años. Él se dedica desde hace 5 años, a la venta de plantas ornamentales, negocio que inició desde hace 5 años, con un capital producto de la liquidación como empleado de un vivero, donde aprendió a cultivar plantas y cuando estuvo listo para desarrollar su autonomía,  empezó en el patio de su casa a cultivar y sembrar semillas para venderlas  a clientes en diversos viveros, negocio que aun tiene. Su meta es crecer cada día más y hoy tiene el gran desafío de tener un capital de trabajo mas, para comprar en mayor volumen semillas y plantas para el jardín así como poteras donde crezcan hermosas plantas, que al final adornaran las casas, oficinas de muchos de sus clientes. Esta es la razón de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para cumplir con su propósito de crecimiento. Su sueño es poseer su propia vivienda y un lote de gran tamaño, donde pueda cultivar plantas y extenderse en otros nichos de mercado.
texts.en:
Ismael is 21 years old, and lives with his partner and their two children, ages one and five. He has made a living for the past five years selling ornamental plants. He started his business five years ago with capital that he received in a package when he ended his previous job at a plant nursery. In his time spent working in the nursery, he learned how to grow and cultivate plants, and when he was ready to tackle the trade on his own, he started by planting seeds and growing plants in the patio of his home. He sold his products to clients of various nurseries, and still continues those sales.

His goal is to grow his business a little bit every day, and to increase the amount of seeds and plants he can buy. He wants to buy larger pots for growing beautiful plants that will one day live in the homes and offices of his clients. This goal of growth has led him to request a loan through Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. His dream is to own his own home on a large lot where he can cultivate plants and offer a wider variety of products to fill more niches in the market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in bulk, plants for his nursery, and pots for growing beautiful plants.

loans.name: Bintiabed

texts.en:
Bintiabed is a married woman with two children, and one of them is in school. She has been selling clothes for the past six years. In addition, she operates a green grocery, selling to her neighbors. She aims at opening a boutique in the future. Credit defaulters are a major challenge hindering the growth of her businesses. 

Bintiabed has rented a house that has electricity but no piped water. She joined Yehu to get loans. This loan of Ksh 40,000 will enable her to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tumennast

texts.en: Tumennast is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his children are school and kindergarten students. He started his public transportation business in 2005 with his own vehicle. Over the years he has gained many regular customers, and his business is highly in-demand. However, his vehicle broke down, and it needs serious maintenance to run properly. He is a sharp and hard-working man who says, "Since my business is the only source of income for my family, I can't afford to lose my business like this." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits and operates her business from home. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, watermelon and pineapples. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and to start growing some of those fruits and vegetables herself. She would also like to buy a plot of land so as to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, watermelon and pineapples.

loans.name: Zevegsuren

texts.en: Zevegsuren is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, and their two children are school students. She started her sewing business in early 2011. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she has a vast amount of experience in sewing, and she has a professional certificate. Her business is well-known around the neighborhood for her skills and excellent service. Now that her business is picking up, she needs a more powerful sewing machine and more raw materials. She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy additional equipment and raw materials.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 35 years old, married to Tobias, and blessed with two children, aged seven and four years respectively.  She sells clothes, a business she started two years ago, and she earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 25,000 to purchase two bales of jackets and a bale of bedcovers. The profit she earns will be plowed back into her business. 

Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of jackets and a bale of bedcovers.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 27 years old, married to Grace, and blessed with two children, aged six and four years respectively.  He is a boda-boda (motorcycle) operator, a business he started five years ago, and he earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

He wants to start another line of business; that is, an electronic shop, and so he has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase electronic spares to stock the shop. 

The anticipated profit will help him expand this business. He dreams of being a renowned supplier of electronic spares in town. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase electronic spares.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells second-hand shoes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but they have no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Rodis Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of Rodis Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have two children—one in primary school and one in secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, fish, etc. With her share of this loan, Isatu will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, fish, etc., at wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento De La Cñia. Yhaca Roysa Group

texts.es:
La juntade Saneamiento de la Compañia Yhaca Roysa  fue creada el 2 de setiembre del año 2006 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del liquido imprescindible a los vecinos de esa zona.
 Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con dos pozos y dos tanques propios, la distribucion de agua y todos los usuarios cuentan con medidores en su totalidad, lo que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. Gracias a esta aguateria 308 personas pueden tener agua y de esa forma tener acceso a algo tan imprescindible para todo ser humano.
Solicitan el crédito para la excavación de un nuevo pozo, con lo cual desean poder seguir haciendo llegar a las personas este servicio tan importante.
texts.en:
The Sanitation Board in the Yhaca Roysa Company was created on September 2, 2006, and since that time it has provided essential fluids to the residents in the region.

Now the board says that with two wells and two of their own tanks, they distribute water to all of their users, and continue to provide this important service.  Thanks to this water source, 308 people can have water and for this reason, they have access to something so essential for all human beings.

The board is seeking a loan to excavate a new well, which they need to be able to continue bringing to the people this important service.

loans.use: to drill a new water well.

loans.name: Virginia Wangari

texts.en:
Virginia used her previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable. She was able to pay all the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy potatoes, beans, and maize seeds, as well as buy fertilizer for use on her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her farming methods and make more income, hence improve the living standards of her family.
