Hirza will use the profits to continue rebuilding her house. Little by little, she plans to finish building it. Her most important challenge is to continue improving her business. She is really focused on helping her children to get a better education, good health and a better life.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 18 años, es una joven que vive con su madre y hermanos menores en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Su padre falleció hace poco y ahora ella debe apoyar a su madre en las labores del campo. Se dedican al cultivo de achiote, paltas y naranjas. “Es rentable, los cítricos se venden bien estos meses, cada canasta está a 18 soles”, comenta. El naranjal bota sus frutos cada 15 días.
Ella y su madre poseen 5 parcelas de terreno, por eso asegura que no le faltará el dinero para pagar los préstamos que solicite.
Al mismo tiempo se encarga de atender su tienda de abarrotes y comestibles que han instalado en su casa, lleva 2 años en esta actividad.
Gracias al trabajo coordinado, ella y su madre pueden mantener a su familia, cubriendo las necesidades básicas. Ahora quieren ampliar la tienda, comprando más productos y no descuidar a sus clientes frecuentes.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, dice que pagará sin dificultad las cuotas mensuales. Ella ingresó al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” por recomendación de vecinos, donde se siente cómoda de tener compañeros confiables.
Raquel invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para su negocio. También pagará a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Raquel is 18 years old and lives with her mother and younger brothers in an indigenous community of Chanchamayo. Her father recently passed away, and now she needs to support her mother in her work in the fields. They grow avacados, oranges and achiote. "It is profitable; the oranges are selling well at the moment. Every basket brings in 18 soles ", she said. They harvest fruit from the orange grove every 15 days. She and her mother have 5 parcels of land; thus it is certain that she will have the money to repay the loans she is seeking. At the same time she has set up her own shop in her house where she sells groceries and supplies. She has been doing this for two years. Thanks to their coordinated work, she and her mother can take care of their family, covering their basic expenses. Now they want to expand the shop, purchasing more products and taking good care of their regular customers. This will be her first loan with MFP. She says she will be able to make the monthly repayments without difficulty. She joined the communal bank “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” upon the recommendation of her neighbors, and she feels comfortable in this group and has trust in her fellow members. Raquel will invest the money she is seeking in the purchase of groceries and other products for her business. She will also use the money to pay laborers with whom she will contract to harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la venta de enchape y cosméticos de empresas como AVON, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y hermanos, Lorena se dedica a comercializar cosméticos, lo aprendió desde joven, tiene una experiencia de 15 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de unos pedidos de productos cosméticos y enchape en diferentes estilos, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su inventario e incrementar las ganancias.
La aspiración de Lorena es crecer en el comercio de cosméticos y enchape, desarrollándose como comerciante para poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lorena sells plated jewelry and cosmetics from companies, such as Avon. She lives in her own home with her children and her siblings. Lorena sells cosmetics since she learned this trade as a young woman. She has 15 years of experience.

Lorena is currently requesting a loan so that she can submit a few orders for cosmetics and plated jewelry in different styles. This loan will help improve her inventory so that she can increase her earnings. Lorena aspires to grow in the business of offering cosmetics and plated jewelry, develop as a merchant, and offer her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and plated jewelry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 22 años, vive con Walter, con quien tiene 2 hijos; de 3 años y otro de 8 meses de nacido. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa en Chanchamayo.

Ella es una joven que trabaja con dedicación por el futuro de su familia. Desde que unió su vida a la de Walter empezó a trabajar en lo que pudo, pero con la inteligencia que la caracteriza hace dos meses decidió abrir un negocio de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. "Empecé vendiendo bebidas heladas, ahora mi tienda está bien surtida, me va bien", comenta.
Así también, cuenta con sembríos de naranjas y plátanos, para ello arrienda terrenos que paga con dinero y con los frutos que cosecha. Hace un año que se dedica a las labores del campo con la ayuda de su esposo. La mayor parte del tiempo está en su tienda y cuidando a sus pequeños hijos, por ello debe de contratar personal operario para trabajar sus tierras. Ruth menciona que recién está empezando a formar un negocio estable para sustentar a su familia, pero confía que con el apoyo de los préstamos y su esfuerzo puede lograr una calidad de vida decente para sus hijos.

Esta es la primera vez que Ruth solicita un crédito de MFP, por esa razón está decidida a pagar las cuotas puntualmente. Se integró al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", donde se siente cómoda y a gusto de tener compañeros responsables.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería necesaria para surtir su negocio de abarrotes. Lo restante será para pagar al personal que limpiará sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old.  She lives with Walter, with whom she has two children who are three years old.  She is also 8 months pregnant with a third child.  They live in their own house in the indigenous community of Santa Rosa in Chanchamayo.

She works with great dedication for the future of her family.  Since she joined her life with Walter's, she started to work where she could find employment, but with her characteristic intelligence, she decided two months ago to open a business selling groceries and basic supplies.  "I started out selling frozen drinks, and now my store is well-stocked", she said. 

She also rents plots where she grows oranges and bananas; she pays the rent with the money she makes from the fruit that she harvests.  She has been doing this for one year with the help of her husband.  She spends the majority of her time in her store and taking care of her small children.  Thus, she needs to hire help someone to help her in the fields.  She says that the her business has recently begun to stabilize and allow her to sustain her family, but she is confident that with the support of these loans and her effort she will be able to achieve a better quality of life for her children.

This is the first loan Ruth is seeking from MFP.  For this reason she is determined to make her repayments punctually.  She joined the communal bank "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", where she feels comfortable and enjoys having responsible companions.

With the funds she is seeking, she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  The remainder will be to pay the laborers who harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: El Tesoro Group

texts.en:
Negra is the coordinator of this group, which is named El Tesoro (The Treasure). The group is located in one of the rural communities of San Pedro de Macoris that surround sugarcane fields, known as 'Bateyes.' Negra is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business, which she conducts by walking; she sells miscellaneous products such as clothes, underwear, and cosmetics. She is also the mother of two children. She lives alone with her long-term partner because their children live separately in their own homes.

Negra is receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza International after having successfully repaid all her previous loans. She started her business with her first loan from Esperanza almost four years ago. She will use this loan to purchase clothes, underwear, and cosmetics for her business. She will reinvest her profits in her business because May and June are good months for sales. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothes, underwear, cosmetics, etc. for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 27 años, vive con Jaime, el padre de sus 2 hijos, de 7 y 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, es decir cuando llegó a vivir a esa zona al iniciar su familia junto a su esposo. El trabajo del campo es cansado pero a ella le gusta porque se distrae mientras limpia sus cultivos. En todos estos años aprendió a cultivar diversos productos como; las frutas cítricas (naranjas, tanyarinas, mandarinas, tanyelos, lima dulce), achiote, plátanos y yucas. “La mayor parte de mi tiempo la paso en el campo, limpiando mis chacras de la mala yerba”, menciona. Así también se encarga de fertilizar sus terrenos con la ayuda de su esposo y algunos jornaleros que contrata. Su negocio de venta de frutas al por mayor es rentable. “Cada mes envío plátano, achiote y cítricos hacia Lima (ciudad capital). El año pasado coseché 400 kilos de achiote sólo de media parcela y las ventas fueron muy buenas”, menciona orgullosa.
Olga quiere abrir un negocio de comida en el puerto de su comunidad, allí piensa ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos a los transeúntes. Confía en su esfuerzo y dedicación.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso dice que pagará las cuotas puntualmente. Ella se acaba de integrar al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, un grupo sólido y responsable.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá adquirir semillas de yuca y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de plátanos.
texts.en: Olga is 27 years old and lives with Jaime, the father of her two children, aged 4 and 7 years. They live together in their own house in the indigenous community of Chanchamayo. She has worked in agriculture for 8 years; she started this at the same time she arrived in this area to start her family with her husband. The work in the fields is tiring but she likes it because it is enjoyable to harvest her crops. In all these years she has learned to cultivate many different crops, such as citrus fruits (oranges, tangerines, mandarins, tangelos, sweet limes), achiote, bananas and yucas. "I spend the majority of my time pulling weeds in my fields", she says. She also fertilizes her land with the help of her husband and day laborers that she hires. Her business of selling fruit is profitable. "Every month I send bananas, achiote and citrus fruits to Lima (the capital city). Last year I harvested 400 kilograms of achiote from just half a plot, and the sales were very good", she proudly adds. Olga wants to open a business seling food near the entrance of her community. She wishes to offer breakfast and lunch to people who are passing through. She is confident in her dedication and efforts in this endeavor. This will be her first loan through MSP and says that she will make her repayments punctually. She just joined the communal bank “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, a solid and responsible group. With the proceeds from the loan she will be able to aquire yuca seeds and fertilizer for her banana trees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cherus

texts.en:
Cherus is 32 years old and lives in Lower Rizal, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Cherus sells snacks to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase sugar, flour and bananas for her snack vending business.

Cherus has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour and bananas for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en: Kaingu is taking out another loan of 50,000 KES to expand his existing business. The loan will enable him to purchase a motorbike. His goal is to open a shop in the future. The previous loan allowed him to increase his monthly income. His standard of living has improved.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 48 years old. He is the father of three children between the ages of five and fifteen, all of whom attend school. 

He has been in the business of selling fruits. He believes in his business and wants to further expand it by requesting a loan to add more oranges and mangoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur est un jeune menuisier mètallique, agè de 40 ans qui s' active depuis plus de 5 ans dèja.Il s'appelle Ousmane et est propriètaire d'un atelier artisanal ou il se dèbrouille pour gèrer sa dèpense quotidienne. Il a dèjà eu 2 crèdits à l' IMCEC et veut un renouvellement pour l'achat de fer, taule, pour fabriquer des portes et des fenetres destinès à la commercialisation.Il commence sa journèe à 8h et la termine à 20h.
Ousmane gère la location de son atelier, la dèpense quotidienne,l' eau et l' èlectricitè.
Il projette d'ouvrir un grand atelier dans l'avenir et d'augmenter sa production.
texts.en:
The borrower, age 40, is a young sheet metal worker who has been actively involved in his profession for more than five years already.  His name is Ousmane.  He owns a small fabrication shop and manages his daily expenses quite well.  

He has already received two loans from UIMCEC and is requesting a new loan for the purchase of iron and steel sheets which will be used to manufacture doors and windows for resale.  His work day starts at 8 AM and ends at 8PM.  Ousmane manages expenses related to the renting out of his shop, he also takes care of daily expenses such as water and electricity.  His future plan is to open a larger shop and to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy iron and steel sheets to manufacture windows and doors for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: La Reforma 2, 3, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 2, 3, 5 & 7 (Reform). She has a long-term partner and is a mother with 4 children, all living with her in a simply structured home, in a rural village of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activity here is the free-trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

Cristina has been selling gasoline for approximately 10 and a half years. She used some money she had to start the business. She plans to use this loan to buy more gallons of gasoline. She will reinvest the profits in her business so she can expand her sales and supply more clients. This is her 10th loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about it. She has been investing all her loans in her business, which has made it possible to respond to the need for gasoline in her community. She sells her gasoline at a small stall next to one of the main roads in her village. Cristina thanks you all for your support of her group's dreams.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 21 años, es una joven soltera que vive con su madre en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura y actualmente cuenta con 2 lotes de terrenos de cultivos que sus padres le otorgaron para que sea independice. En ellos siembra plátanos, achiote, yuca y frutas cítricas. El trabajo es muy cansado, por eso recibe la ayuda de sus hermanos y padres, pero cuando las jornadas son intensas recurre a contratar jornaleros para las cosechas y la limpieza de sus cultivos. “Estos meses se vende bien los cítricos, el café también, aunque este año el precio está un poco bajo”, menciona. La mayor parte de su producción la negocia en su propia comunidad. Yanet está contenta con su labor, porque todo lo que obtiene es producto de su esfuerzo. Ahora espera producir otra parcela de yucas, para ello comprará semillas y fertilizantes.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar las cuotas sin dificultad, por su compromiso con la entidad. Ella ingresó a formar parte del banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, donde comparte gratos momentos y apoyo económico.
Invertirá el dinero el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de semillas de yucas y bolsas de abono orgánico para una nueva siembra.
texts.en: Yanet is 21 years old, single and lives with her mother in the community of Chanchamayo, Peru. For the past three years she has made a living in agriculture and currently has two plots of lands that her parents gave her to become independent. She plants bananas, annatto, yucca and citrus fruits on the land. The work is very tiring, so she receives help from her parents and siblings, but when the tasks are intense she hires day laborers to harvest and clean the crops. "These past months the citrus fruits are selling well, coffee too, although the price this year is a little low," she says. The majority of her produce she sells to her own community. Yanet is content with her work because she sees her efforts bear fruit. Now she hopes to produce another plot of yucca, for which she will buy seeds and fertilizer. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments with ease. She joined the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, where she shares pleasant moments and economic support. She plans to invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of yucca seeds and bags of organic fertilizer for the new harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 48-year-old widow. She sells vegetables and fruits, and will use this loan to buy more mangoes, tree tomatoes, passion fruits and tomatoes to sell. Beatrice wants to reinvest her profits in the business because it has helped her sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, tree tomatoes, passion fruits and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Kasaija

texts.en: Kasaija is 47 years old. He has seven children and lives in Hioma,Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he has been operating for five years. Kasaija's challenges are high price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. Kasaija intends to use this loan to purchase general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell

loans.name: Twungubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe Twungubumwe  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  33 ans et est marié à Elysée. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, dont 1 étudie.
Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz,haricot,savons,...)  depuis 2 ans. 

Il  est à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de boutique(riz, haricot, savons,..,) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il espère améliorer la situation familiale grâce aux crédits de Turame Community Finance S.a.
texts.en:
Etienne is part of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Elysée. They have three children, and one of them goes to school. 

He’s been working in a boutique (rice, beans, soaps) for the past 2 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With his KIVA credit, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his boutique (rice, beans, soaps) to resell and increase his earnings. 

Over the next few years, he would like to improve his family's status with the help of loans from Turame Community Finance SA.

loans.use: he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his boutique (rice, beans, soaps) to resell and increase his earnings.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín tiene 44 años, vive con Sandra, con quien se unió hace poco. Ellos desean tener hijos, pero quieren adquirir algunas comodidades para su hogar primero, antes de recibir a los nuevos miembros de la familia. Viven en la casa que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo. 

Él lleva 23 años viviendo en esa zona, desde entonces de dedica al cultivo de cítricos, café y achiote, para ello cuenta con 8 parcelas de terreno distribuidas en distintas partes. "Me conviene sembrar más café y achiote, su cosecha es una vez al año, pero su venta es inmediata", menciona. Actualmente se encuentra cosechando naranjas y mandarinas, las cuales vende en su propia comunidad, ya que los compradores ya conocen de la calidad de sus frutos y lo visitan para adquirir sus productos. Con el apoyo de los jornaleros, a quienes contrata, puede abarcar las 8 extensiones de cultivos que posee. El trabajo no es nada fácil, por eso Sandra también da de su parte llevando la comida y las bebidas frías, y cuando termina con la comida, coge las herramientas de trabajo de campo para ayudarlo.
Sus planes más cercanos son de mejorar su producción de café y achiote, para ello comprará nuevas plantitas que colocará en los espacios vacíos de sus sembríos y además cambiará el cafetal que ya no produce, por plantas nuevas. 

Éste es el préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP. Pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", donde se siente satisfecho del trabajo desplegado en todos estos ciclos como socio responsable.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá pagar el servicio de los jornaleros para la limpieza de sus cultivos. Con lo restante comprará bolsas de abono para sus sembríos de cítricos y cafetales.
texts.en: Joaquín is 44 years old and lives with Sandra, whom he has been with for a little while. They want to have children, but they want to acquire some comforts for their home first before welcoming new members of the family. They live in a house they built in the native community of Chanchamayo, Peru. Joaquín has lived in the area for 23 years, and since then has made a living growing citrus fruit, coffee and annatto distinctly distributed over eight plots of land. "It suits me to plant more coffee and annatto. It's harvested once a year, but it sells immediately," he says. Currently he is harvesting oranges and mandarins, which he sells within his community since the buyers already know the quality of his fruit and visit him to acquire the products. With the support of hired day laborers he can cover the eight areas of crops he has. The work is far from easy, so Sandra does her part by bringing food and cold drinks, and when the meals are finished she picks up field-working tools to help out. Joaquín's plans for the near future are to increase his coffee and annatto production by buying new seedlings to put in the empty spaces and also changing out the coffee plants that aren't producing for new ones. This is his eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP. He belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, where he feels satisfied with the work carried out over all these loan cycles as a responsible member. With the money he is requesting, he plans to hire day laborers to clean his crops and use the rest to purchase sacks of fertilizer for his citrus and coffee plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer.

Restituta sells bananas and yams to her community. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Restituta wants to be able to provide for all of her family's needs. She requested a loan to buy more bananas and yams to sell. She hopes for her small business to grow and for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and yams to sell

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Florida is 40 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have eight children: six of them go to school and the other two are still too young. Florida has sold fruits for the past five years. With the loan, she will buy more passion fruits, tomatoes, and pineapples for selling. She plans to use the profits from the business to pay school fees for the children currently enrolled in school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is a hardworking married woman with eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a retail shop and the business is very profitable, despite challenges in high fuel and transportation costs, coupled with inflation. She desires to educate her children and expand her business into a supermarket. Delfina wants a loan to buy sugar and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for selling

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 26 years old. He is single and very happy with his business of showing movies in the trading center he lives in. He normally burns CDs and DVDs for movies and songs. He has been in the business for the past three years. The profits from the business are projected to be reinvested into the same business for the better future of his business.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and burn CDs, along with making movies for selling

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is the mother of a single child who is enrolled in school. She operates a tailoring business from home, which serves her neighbors. She dreams of opening a tailoring and dress-making college in the future. Emily owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. She has been in this business for the past 10 years, previously selling fried potatoes. Credit defaulters pose her as a major challenge. She spends more on food over the month.
The loan of KES 25,000 will enable her to purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad es originaria de la isla de Ometepe actualmente vive en Granada, soltera, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de quesillos un plato tipico y muy sabroso solicitado por los turistas que visitan la ciudad,  madre de 2 hijos. Inicio su actividad desde muy joven ayudándole a su mama, luego  decide independizarse se dedica a vender enchiladas(comida) para aportar con los gastos del hogar ya que salió embarazada de su primer hijo, después con el tiempo vio que la venta de quesillo  era muy buena pues le generaba  mas ganancias decide buscar a un amigo  que le ayudara a conseguir marteria prima mas barata, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos comercializando sus productos en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores de Granada. Cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes del esposo que le pasa remesas para los gastos del hogar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar queso, cebolla, vinagre, tortillas y crema que son parte de los ingredientes que se utilizan para la venta de quesillo, ella estima que el préstamo le ayudara ya que viene la temporada de mayores ventas podrá ofrecer mas cantidad del producto a su clientela, como meta próxima espera  pagar con las ganancias que le genere la venta de quesillo el préstamo para luego solicitar un nuevo crédito con el objetivo de hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is originally from the island of Ometepe and today lives in Granada.  She lives on her own while her husband is away, and works as a food vendor selling quesillos, a typical and flavorful Mexican dish that is very popular with the tourists that visit the city.  She is a mother of two.  

She started making quesillos when she was very young helping by her mother.  She decided to start her own business and originally sold enchiladas to help with the expenses around the house during the time she was pregnant with her first child.  Later she discovered that she earned more money by selling quesillos and decided to work with a friend who could help her find better and cheaper ingredients.

Her children help her with the business, selling their products in Granada and the surrounding neighborhoods.  Her husband also helps with the household expenses by sending money home.  

She will use her loan to buy cheese, onions, vinegar, tortillas and sour cream, which are all ingredients that make up the quesillo.  Rosa hopes that the loan will help her since the busy season is approaching and she will be able to offer more products to her clients.  

After she pays off this loan she wants to use the profits combined with a new loan to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy cheese, onions, vinegar, tortillas, and sour cream
